intro: Origanum vulgare var. album, commonly known as white marjoram, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers and aromatic, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is often used in herbal medicine and culinary applications due to its essential oils. The white flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
